column4: this may sound like a really stupid question but how do i find out my remote computer ip to connect to it when im away from the remote computer?
if that makes sense
nslookup <hostname>
I assume you know the hostname.
but im not on my network
OK, what information do you know?
my hostname is ambassador
and thats it, but i can find out more if needed?
If the network is behind a router you will need to set up the router to forward the port.
so i have to use ssh?
Yes (probably)
confusing lol
do you have any wiki's or something?
Yes, you will need to use ssh to log in remotely.  I said probably, because you might be wanting to connect to some other server, such as a web server or an ftp server.
how about a webserver with torrentflux on it
how would i connect to that
What is your setup?  Is it a network behind a router?
yeah i have DSL then  a router then my comp
and the ip would look something like this yeah?, 218.254.11.258:698
If you don't have a fixed ip address there are ways of getting your address fixed to a hostname each time you connect, but I don't know too much about that.
218.254.11.258 is the ip address and 698 is the port.
thanks ill have a look
So, for example, I have port 22 (ssh) set to forward to machine 10.0.0.254 on my local network.
a thousand thanks
